page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The small village of{Frosterley}lies in the heart of Weardale in a deep sided river valley,midway between {Wolsingham}and{Stanhope}with the{River {Wear}to the South of the village. Most of the houses border the{A689} road which runs parellel to the river with small council estates at either end. On the Southern side of the valley lie the small hamlets of {Bollihope, White Kirkley, Hill End}and {Bridge End.} The area is ringed with old quarries and their spoil heaps, one of which has been worked from Norman times until recently. Beyond these lie the farmland and above that is wild moorland. A landmark is the clump of trees on the horizon called {Elephant Trees.} It is a popular tourist area.
